title: Manchester Arndale stabbings: Hero shop worker saved others from being knifed
text:

A shop worker has been hailed a hero for risking their life to confront a knifeman and prevent others from being stabbed at Manchester's Arndale centre.

The worker and a member of the public had "challenged" and "deterred" the lone attacker before the suspect was Tasered and arrested by police.

Three people were injured during the stabbings and a 40-year-old man has been detained under the Mental Health Act.

Terrified shoppers ran for their lives while others barricaded themselves inside stores with staff as the attack unfolded on Friday.

Have you been affected by this story? Email webnews@mirror.co.uk

A witness said the weapon was "about 12ins long and looked like a machete".

Police described the shop worker who intervened as "heroic" after they prevented others from being stabbed.

A senior officer told the Sunday Times that the worker, along with a member of the public, had "challenged" and "deterred" the attacker.

A suspect was arrested within five minutes on suspicion of the commission, preparation and instigation of an act of terrorism.

He was later detained under the Mental Health Act.

(Image: Manchester Evening News)

Counter-terrorism officers continue to lead the investigation and are keeping an open mind about the motive.

It is understood no political, religious or ideological motivation has so far been uncovered.

The victims included a 19-year-old woman, identified by a friend as Chloe McGurk, of Glengormley in Northern Ireland.

It is understood she suffered wounds to her arm and armpit, which required surgery.

Miss McGurk's friend, Ellen da Conceicao, who was with her at the time, wrote on Facebook: "All we wanted to do was come over to Manchester for a girly weekend, but instead the first shopping centre we step into this happens."

(Image: MEN MEDIA)

Miss da Conceicao told how she was struggling to get "that man's face and knife out of my head and probably won't for a very long time".

A 59-year-old man received stab wounds to his hand and palm, a 33-year-old woman received a cut to her stomach and a 43-year-old woman was assessed by medics but appeared uninjured.

Greater Manchester Police said in its latest statement: "The 40-year-old man, who was arrested on suspicion of committing a terrorism offence, has now been assessed by specialist doctors and compulsorily detained under the Mental Health Act.

"The investigation will continue in order to fully understand the motives behind the attack.

"There is not believed to be any wider threat to the communities of Greater Manchester and the attacker is believed to have acted alone."

The shopping centre is just a few hundred yards from Manchester Arena, where 22 people were killed in May 2017 when Salman Abedi detonated a suicide bomb following an Ariana Grande concert.
description: The Manchester Arndale shopping centre worker and another person "challenged" and "deterred" the attacker
